intro: Morisonia americana var. subpeltata, commonly known as the broad-leafed morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
